alert.note: Alert for McMinn; Northwest Monroe; Roane (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 13 at 7:24PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN LOUDON...EASTERN MCMINN...WESTERN MONROE AND SOUTH CENTRAL ROANE COUNTIES THROUGH 900 PM EDT... At 824 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Fairview to 6 miles southwest of Sweetwater to near Athens. Movement was southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Athens, Sweetwater, Loudon, Madisonville, Fairview, Etowah, Englewood, Niota, Philadelphia, and Paint Rock. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Morristown.
